conclusion: Given that the spring scales read F1 when the current is I and F2 when the current is 2I, we can use the principles of electromagnetism to find the magnetic field B.
When the current is I, the magnetic force acting on the wire is F_mag = BIL. This force is balanced by the tension in the spring scales, so F1 = BIL.
When the current is 2I, the magnetic force acting on the wire is F_mag = B(2I)L = 2BIL. This force is balanced by the tension in the spring scales, so F2 = 2BIL.
Dividing the second equation by the first equation, we get F2/F1 = (2BIL)/(BIL) = 2. This means that F2 = 2F1.
Substituting F2 = 2F1 into the second equation, we get 2F1 = 2BIL. Simplifying, we get F1 = BIL.
Solving for B, we get B = F1/(IL).
Therefore, the magnitude of the magnetic field B is boxed{F1/(IL)}.
